values.description:
Fixes and code to be able to compile sdformat on Windows. Some quick notes:

 * All compiler flags need to be filtered
 * setenv/unstenv are not POSIX compliant. I made a wrapper using the _putenv.
 * By now, include all tinyxml sources when compiled the tests (it can be improved in the future).
values.title: Port sdformat to compile on Windows (MSVC)

summary.raw:
Fixes and code to be able to compile sdformat on Windows. Some quick notes:

 * All compiler flags need to be filtered
 * setenv/unstenv are not POSIX compliant. I made a wrapper using the _putenv.
 * By now, include all tinyxml sources when compiled the tests (it can be improved in the future).
summary.html:
Fixes and code to be able to compile sdformat on Windows. Some quick notes:

  • All compiler flags need to be filtered
  • setenv/unstenv are not POSIX compliant. I made a wrapper using the _putenv.
  • By now, include all tinyxml sources when compiled the tests (it can be improved in the future).

values.description: pull request #77 was added [as a patch](http://anonscm.debian.org/gitweb/?p=debian-science/packages/sdformat.git;a=blob;f=debian/patches/0001-Support-to-use-external-URDF.patch;h=adce2166161d653e8748b3a9b960ff8c02be8230;hb=69a8bd999590241e73ec91071daa007a9e44833a) to debian released 1.4.11, but debian released urdfdom is versioned at 0.2.x, so breaking sdformat's urdf parser.  This pull request checks to see if external urdf library version is < 0.3, skip changes per pull request #77.
values.title: attempt to fix issue #63

summary.raw: pull request #77 was added [as a patch](http://anonscm.debian.org/gitweb/?p=debian-science/packages/sdformat.git;a=blob;f=debian/patches/0001-Support-to-use-external-URDF.patch;h=adce2166161d653e8748b3a9b960ff8c02be8230;hb=69a8bd999590241e73ec91071daa007a9e44833a) to debian released 1.4.11, but debian released urdfdom is versioned at 0.2.x, so breaking sdformat's urdf parser.  This pull request checks to see if external urdf library version is < 0.3, skip changes per pull request #77.
summary.html: pull request #77 was added as a patch to debian released 1.4.11, but debian released urdfdom is versioned at 0.2.x, so breaking sdformat's urdf parser. This pull request checks to see if external urdf library version is < 0.3, skip changes per pull request #77.

values.description:
Several fixes we found while working on windows:

 * configure.bat is a helper script to compile sdformat without the need of system libraries
 * tinyxml headers need to be installed when building internal tinyxml
 * When build gazebo, MSVC is complaining about a duplicate symbol when no explicit destructor is defined.
 * Added INSTALL_WIN32.md with instructions about how to build it on Windows
values.title: Fixes to compile on Windows

summary.raw:
Several fixes we found while working on windows:

 * configure.bat is a helper script to compile sdformat without the need of system libraries
 * tinyxml headers need to be installed when building internal tinyxml
 * When build gazebo, MSVC is complaining about a duplicate symbol when no explicit destructor is defined.
 * Added INSTALL_WIN32.md with instructions about how to build it on Windows
summary.html:
Several fixes we found while working on windows:

  • configure.bat is a helper script to compile sdformat without the need of system libraries
  • tinyxml headers need to be installed when building internal tinyxml
  • When build gazebo, MSVC is complaining about a duplicate symbol when no explicit destructor is defined.
  • Added INSTALL_WIN32.md with instructions about how to build it on Windows

values.description:
There is a [qt4 bug](https://bugreports.qt-project.org/browse/QTBUG-22829) that causes build failures when some boost header files are present in a moc invocation. This was previously fixed in pull request #14, but boost 1.57 has re-broken this, such that [gazebo fails to build](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issue/1399/build-fails-with-boost-157). Note that boost 1.57 is the current default version on mac homebrew.

To be safe, I've added all boost header files from Param.hh to the `#ifndef` block, which has fixed the build issues in my testing.

I will make a companion pull request to gazebo, since there are other required changes there.
values.title: Fix gazebo build with boost 1.57 (qt bug 22829)

summary.raw:
There is a [qt4 bug](https://bugreports.qt-project.org/browse/QTBUG-22829) that causes build failures when some boost header files are present in a moc invocation. This was previously fixed in pull request #14, but boost 1.57 has re-broken this, such that [gazebo fails to build](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issue/1399/build-fails-with-boost-157). Note that boost 1.57 is the current default version on mac homebrew.

To be safe, I've added all boost header files from Param.hh to the `#ifndef` block, which has fixed the build issues in my testing.

I will make a companion pull request to gazebo, since there are other required changes there.
summary.html:
There is a qt4 bug that causes build failures when some boost header files are present in a moc invocation. This was previously fixed in pull request #14, but boost 1.57 has re-broken this, such that gazebo fails to build. Note that boost 1.57 is the current default version on mac homebrew.

To be safe, I've added all boost header files from Param.hh to the #ifndef block, which has fixed the build issues in my testing.

I will make a companion pull request to gazebo, since there are other required changes there.

values.description:
A proposed fix for [drcsim issue #447](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/drcsim/issue/447/world-2-brings-up-blank-screen).

instead of calling `sdf::init`, a new sdf ptr is created by cloning an existing template sdf ptr

on my desktop `sdf::init` takes ~0.03s vs `Clone()` which takes ~0.005s
values.title: Improve performance in loading <include> SDF elements

summary.raw:
A proposed fix for [drcsim issue #447](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/drcsim/issue/447/world-2-brings-up-blank-screen).

instead of calling `sdf::init`, a new sdf ptr is created by cloning an existing template sdf ptr

on my desktop `sdf::init` takes ~0.03s vs `Clone()` which takes ~0.005s
summary.html:
A proposed fix for drcsim issue #447.

instead of calling sdf::init, a new sdf ptr is created by cloning an existing template sdf ptr

on my desktop sdf::init takes ~0.03s vs Clone() which takes ~0.005s

values.description:
This is an alternative to pull request #122 that provides support for urdfdom 0.3 and updates the forked copy of urdfdom to 0.3. The branch in pull request #122 is currently [failing the INTEGRATION_fixed_joint_reduction test](https://drone.io/bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/413). I was debugging how to fix it and ended up making a separate branch and found a pretty compact fix for the broken test (see f2a9af3).

[Here is a comparison](#!/osrf/sdformat/branches/compare/urdf_0.3..update_urdfdom_0.3_jrivero#diff) of this branch with the branch in pull request #122. It only differs in the `ReduceCollisionToParent` and `ReduceVisualToParent` functions.

I will update with CI status.
values.title: Support urdfdom 0.3 (alternative to pull request #122)

This is an alternative to pull request #122 that provides support for urdfdom 0.3 and updates the forked copy of urdfdom to 0.3. The branch in pull request #122 is currently [failing the INTEGRATION_fixed_joint_reduction test](https://drone.io/bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/413). I was debugging how to fix it and ended up making a separate branch and found a pretty compact fix for the broken test (see f2a9af3).

[Here is a comparison](#!/osrf/sdformat/branches/compare/urdf_0.3..update_urdfdom_0.3_jrivero#diff) of this branch with the branch in pull request #122. It only differs in the `ReduceCollisionToParent` and `ReduceVisualToParent` functions.

I will update with CI status.

values.description:
The collision bitmask field will make it possible to select which links collide or do not collide with each other.

Also added hex parsing, and c++11 support. The cmake changes were ripped from the ign-transport project.
values.title: Added a collision bitmask field to sdf-1.5 and c++11 support

summary.raw:
The collision bitmask field will make it possible to select which links collide or do not collide with each other.

Also added hex parsing, and c++11 support. The cmake changes were ripped from the ign-transport project.

The collision bitmask field will make it possible to select which links collide or do not collide with each other.

Also added hex parsing, and c++11 support. The cmake changes were ripped from the ign-transport project.

values.description:
Part one of the Physics Preset Manager implementation (see [design doc](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo_design/src/e64787224f59902a986c22f7d20fdb39e24b8764/physics_presets/physics_presets.md)).

Adds a "name" attribute to the `physics` element, to differentiate between different physics elements, as well as a `default` boolean to indicate if this element is the default.

[Jenkins job](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-sdformat-any-devel-trusty-amd64/27/) with the corresponding Gazebo branch.
values.title: Physics preset attributes

summary.raw:
Part one of the Physics Preset Manager implementation (see [design doc](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo_design/src/e64787224f59902a986c22f7d20fdb39e24b8764/physics_presets/physics_presets.md)).

Adds a "name" attribute to the `physics` element, to differentiate between different physics elements, as well as a `default` boolean to indicate if this element is the default.

[Jenkins job](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-sdformat-any-devel-trusty-amd64/27/) with the corresponding Gazebo branch.
summary.html:
Part one of the Physics Preset Manager implementation (see design doc).

Adds a "name" attribute to the physics element, to differentiate between different physics elements, as well as a default boolean to indicate if this element is the default.

Jenkins job with the corresponding Gazebo branch.

values.description:
The problem affects latin locales (at least es\_\* and pt\_\*) and maybe others where decimal numbers are represented using comma instead of a dot. It only happens when converting values,  related to glibc which is the one that handles locales.

The fix was easy. The test is not so easy. First, we would need a system with a latin locale already generated. The current implementation should skip the test if no latin locale is present. Second, to get the error and make gtest to fail we should parse the log file to get the output of sdferr. There is no other way of getting the return value from `Param::SetFromString` and unit testing it won't help since no conversion operation is done through glibc.

To see the test failing, remove the std::setlocale line introduced in this pull request, generate a latin locale and see the test output.
values.title: Fix problems with latin locales and decimal numbers (issue #60)

summary.raw:
The problem affects latin locales (at least es\_\* and pt\_\*) and maybe others where decimal numbers are represented using comma instead of a dot. It only happens when converting values,  related to glibc which is the one that handles locales.

The fix was easy. The test is not so easy. First, we would need a system with a latin locale already generated. The current implementation should skip the test if no latin locale is present. Second, to get the error and make gtest to fail we should parse the log file to get the output of sdferr. There is no other way of getting the return value from `Param::SetFromString` and unit testing it won't help since no conversion operation is done through glibc.

To see the test failing, remove the std::setlocale line introduced in this pull request, generate a latin locale and see the test output.
summary.html:
The problem affects latin locales (at least es_* and pt_*) and maybe others where decimal numbers are represented using comma instead of a dot. It only happens when converting values, related to glibc which is the one that handles locales.

The fix was easy. The test is not so easy. First, we would need a system with a latin locale already generated. The current implementation should skip the test if no latin locale is present. Second, to get the error and make gtest to fail we should parse the log file to get the output of sdferr. There is no other way of getting the return value from Param::SetFromString and unit testing it won't help since no conversion operation is done through glibc.

To see the test failing, remove the std::setlocale line introduced in this pull request, generate a latin locale and see the test output.

values.description:
